qas.question: Milena Sterio includes what former axis powers among great powers?
What emerging power is considered a great power?
What G7 members are among great powers?
Which country is debated as intermittent and/or least of great powers?
What international organization members are considered great powers?

plausible_answers.text: intermittent great power" or as "the least of the great powers".

qas.question: What separate status are Germany, Italy and Japan given by various authors?
What permanent member of the UNSC is considered the least of the great powers?
What former axis powers do various authors include as great powers?

plausible_answers.text: due to their G7 membership and because of their influence in regional and international organizations.

qas.question: Why does Milena Sterio consider UNSC members great powers?

context: Milena Sterio, American expert of international law, includes the former axis powers (<a0_0><b7_0>Germany, Italy and Japan<b7_0/><a0_0/>) and <a1_0>India<a1_0/> among the great powers along with the permanent members of the UNSC. She considers <a2_0><b4_0>Germany, Japan and Italy<b4_0/><a2_0/> to be great powers <b8_0>due to their G7 membership and because of their influence in regional and international organizations.<b8_0/>  Various authors describe <b6_0>Italy<b6_0/> as an equal major power, while others view <a3_0>Italy<a3_0/> as an "<b5_0>intermittent great power" or as "the least of the great powers".
